member.name: T:System.Messaging.AccessControlEntryType
member.summary: Specifies whether to allow, deny, or revoke access rights for a trustee.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.AccessControlEntryType.Allow
member.summary: An access-allowed entry that causes the new rights to be added to any existing rights the trustee has.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.AccessControlEntryType.Set
member.summary: An access-allowed entry that is similar to Allow, except that the new entry allows only the specified rights. Using it discards any existing rights, including all existing access-denied entries for the trustee.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.AccessControlEntryType.Deny
member.summary: An access-denied entry that denies the specified rights in addition to any currently denied rights of the trustee.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.AccessControlEntryType.Revoke
member.summary: An entry that removes all existing allowed or denied rights for the specified trustee.

member.name: T:System.Messaging.AcknowledgeTypes
member.summary: Specifies the types of acknowledgment message that Message Queuing returns to the sending application.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.AcknowledgeTypes.PositiveArrival
member.summary: A mask used to request a positive acknowledgment when the original message reaches the queue.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.AcknowledgeTypes.PositiveReceive
member.summary: A mask used to request a positive acknowledgment when the original message is successfully retrieved from the queue.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.AcknowledgeTypes.NegativeReceive
member.summary: A mask used to request a negative acknowledgment when the original message fails to be received from the queue.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.AcknowledgeTypes.None
member.summary: A mask used to request that no acknowledgment messages (positive or negative) be posted.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.AcknowledgeTypes.NotAcknowledgeReachQueue
member.summary: A mask used to request a negative acknowledgment when the original message cannot reach the queue. This can happen when the time-to-reach-queue timer expires or if a message cannot be authenticated.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.AcknowledgeTypes.NotAcknowledgeReceive
member.summary: A mask used to request a negative acknowledgment when an error occurs that prevents the original message from being received from the queue before its time-to-be-received timer expires.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.AcknowledgeTypes.FullReachQueue
member.summary: A mask used to request positive acknowledgment if the original message reaches the queue or negative acknowledgment if the time-to-reach-queue timer expires or if the original message cannot be authenticated.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.AcknowledgeTypes.FullReceive
member.summary: A mask used to request positive acknowledgment if the original message is received from the queue before its time-to-be-received timer expires or negative acknowledgment otherwise.

member.name: T:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment
member.summary: Specifies the result of an attempted message delivery.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.None
member.summary: The message is not an acknowledgment message.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.AccessDenied
member.summary: A negative arrival acknowledgment indicating that the sending application does not have the necessary rights to send a message to the destination queue.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.BadDestinationQueue
member.summary: A negative arrival acknowledgment indicating that the destination queue is not available to the sending application.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.BadEncryption
member.summary: A negative arrival acknowledgment indicating that the destination queue manager could not decrypt a private message.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.BadSignature
member.summary: A negative arrival acknowledgment indicating that the original message's digital signature is not valid and could not be authenticated by Message Queuing.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.CouldNotEncrypt
member.summary: A negative arrival acknowledgment indicating that the source queue manager could not encrypt a private message.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.HopCountExceeded
member.summary: A negative arrival acknowledgment indicating that the original message's hop count (which indicates the number of intermediate servers) was exceeded.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.NotTransactionalQueue
member.summary: A negative arrival acknowledgment indicating that a transactional message was sent to a non-transactional queue.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.NotTransactionalMessage
member.summary: A negative arrival acknowledgment indicating that a non-transactional message was sent to a transactional queue.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.Purged
member.summary: A negative arrival acknowledgment indicating that the message was purged before reaching its destination queue.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.QueueDeleted
member.summary: A negative read acknowledgment indicating that the queue was deleted before the message could be read.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.QueueExceedMaximumSize
member.summary: A negative arrival acknowledgment indicating that the original message was not delivered because its destination queue is full.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.QueuePurged
member.summary: A negative read acknowledgment indicating that the queue was purged before the message could be read.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.ReachQueue
member.summary: A positive arrival acknowledgment indicating that the original message reached its destination queue.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.ReachQueueTimeout
member.summary: A negative arrival acknowledgment indicating that the time-to-reach-queue or time-to-be-received timer expired before the original message could reach the destination queue.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.ReceiveTimeout
member.summary: A negative read acknowledgment indicating that the original message was not received from the queue before its time-to-be-received timer expired.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.Acknowledgment.Receive
member.summary: A positive read acknowledgment indicating that the original message was received by the receiving application.

member.name: T:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType
member.summary: Specifies the cryptographic service providers available for validating digital signatures.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType.None
member.summary: No cryptographic provider type specified.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType.RsaFull
member.summary: The full RSA provider type, which supports both digital signatures and data encryption. Considered a general purpose cryptographic services provider. The RSA public-key algorithm is used for all public-key operations.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType.RsqSig
member.summary: A subset of the RsaFull provider type, which supports only those functions and algorithms required for hashes and digital signatures.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType.Dss
member.summary: A provider type that, like RsqSig, only supports hashes and digital signatures. Dss specifies the Digital Signature Algorithm (DSA) signature algorithm.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType.Fortezza
member.summary: A provider type that contains a set of cryptographic protocols and algorithms owned by the National Institute of Standards and Technology.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType.MicrosoftExchange
member.summary: A provider type designed for the cryptographic needs of the Microsoft Exchange mail application and other applications compatible with Microsoft Mail.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType.Ssl
member.summary: A provider type that supports the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocol.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType.SttMer
member.summary: Secure transaction technology provider enterprise.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType.SttAcq
member.summary: Secure transaction technology provider acquirer.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType.SttBrnd
member.summary: Secure transaction technology provider brand.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType.SttRoot
member.summary: Secure transaction technology provider root.

member.name: F:System.Messaging.CryptographicProviderType.SttIss
member.summary: Secure transaction technology provider issuer.
